answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hello,
Although I do not work for a local government, I have been able to find a few articles describing how funding cuts are affecting local governments. 
Village of Yellow Springs in Ohio has been impacted by the proposed budget cuts for the local government, schools, and libraries. The local government fund will be cut by 21% in the coming year and officials are reviewing department budgets, increasing partnerships to increase savings.  
http://ysnews.com/news/2011/03/state-cuts-have-local-budget-impact 
Russell Township faces a reduced budget for administration, roads and maintenance as the state of Ohio is reducing the funding usually allocated to counties and communities. 
http://www.chagrinvalleytimes.com/NC/0/2687.html 
Oakland, Cali. is facing a $42 million deficit and additional state and federal cuts may lead to the weakening of social programs like the homeless and hunger programs. 
http://oaklandlocal.com/article/proposed-federal-cuts-would-impact-oakland-greatly 
I also found a couple of helpful documents from the Greater Ohio Policy Center, the smart growth organization of the state. 
-   The 2012-13 State Operating Budget - proposes changes and reductions for local governments to improve management. http://obm.ohio.gov/SectionPages/Budget/FY1213/ExecutiveBudget.aspx 
-   The 2012- 13 State Budget Response - recommends legislation changes to facilitate the transformation of local governments including policy tools. http://www.greaterohio.org/files/pdf/go-budget-response-2011.pdf 
And finally, an article, describing a school district in Palmerton, Pa. that has been examining ways to cut costs by renegotiating transportation costs and supplies. Booster clubs have stepped up to help cover costs for school teams and after school activities.  http://www.wfmz.com/lehighvalleynews/27767703/detail.html 
I hope this is helpful,
Pooja Varma
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: James Prosser
text:
It is clear that state and federal government funding for local governments will be reduced.  Some of those cuts could increase government costs over long-term.  Questions related to this change:
1. What are examples of these impacts for you your communities?
2. What planning is being done to assess  and prepare for the negative impacts? 
3. Are there any state/regional/local sponsored efforts to design cutbacks to reduce negative impacts?
title: Planning for state and federal cutbacks
